name: IdCard

commentData.description:
An ID card. Encapsulates credentials and other information required to connect to a specific business network as a specific user.

Instances of this class should be created using {@link IdCard.fromArchive}.

methods.name: getUserName

commentData.description:
Name of the user identity associated with the card. This should be unique within the scope of a given business network and connection profile.

This is a mandatory field.

description: Name of the user identity associated with the card. This should be unique within the scope of a given

methods.name: getDescription

commentData.description: Free text description of the card.

description: Free text description of the card.

methods.name: getBusinessNetworkName

commentData.description:
Name of the business network to which the ID card applies. Generally this will be present but may be
omitted for system cards.

description: Name of the business network to which the ID card applies. Generally this will be present but may be

commentData.description:
Connection profile for this card.

This is a mandatory field.

methods.name: getCredentials

commentData.description:
Credentials associated with this card, and which are used to connect to the associated business network.

For PKI-based authentication, the credentials are expected to be of the form: { certificate: String, privateKey: String }.

description: Credentials associated with this card, and which are used to connect to the associated business network.
For PKI-based authentication, the credentials are expected to be of the form:

methods.name: setCredentials

commentData.description:
Credentials to associate with this card.

For PKI-based authentication, the credentials are expected to be of the form: { certificate: String, privateKey: String }.

description: Credentials to associate with this card.
For PKI-based authentication, the credentials are expected to be of the form:

methods.name: getEnrollmentCredentials

commentData.description:
Enrollment credentials. If there are no credentials associated with this card, these credentials are used to enroll with a business network and obtain certificates.

For an ID/secret enrollment scheme, the credentials are expected to be of the form: { secret: String }.

tags.title: return
tags.description: enrollment credentials, or {@link null} if none exist.

description: Enrollment credentials. If there are no credentials associated with this card, these credentials  are used to
enroll with a business network and obtain certificates.
For an ID/secret enrollment scheme, the credentials are expected to be of the form:
enrollment credentials, or {@link null} if none exist.

methods.name: getRoles

commentData.description:
Special roles for which this ID can be used, which can include:
  • PeerAdmin
  • ChannelAdmin
  • Issuer

description: Special roles for which this ID can be used, which can include:

methods.name: fromArchive

commentData.description:
Create an IdCard from a card archive.

Valid types for zipData are any of the types supported by JSZip.

description: Create an IdCard from a card archive.
Valid types for zipData are any of the types supported by JSZip.

methods.name: toArchive

commentData.description:
Generate a card archive representing this ID card.

The default value for the options.type parameter is arraybuffer. See JSZip documentation for other valid values.

tags.title: param
tags.description: type of the resulting ZIP file data.
tags.name: options.type

tags.title: return
tags.description: Promise of the generated ZIP file; by default an {@link ArrayBuffer}.

description: Generate a card archive representing this ID card.
The default value for the options.type parameter is arraybuffer. See JSZip documentation

parameters.description: type of the resulting ZIP file data.
parameters.name: options.type

description: Promise of the generated ZIP file; by default an {@link ArrayBuffer}.
An ID card. Encapsulates credentials and other information required to connect to a specific business network
Instances of this class should be created using {@link IdCard.fromArchive}.
